biospec_descr.textblock:
Non-interventional study on corneal endothelium, anterior eye chamber fluid and
      paraffin-embedded corneal tissue, using molecular techniques to identify and characterise
      the molecular players involved in the pathogenesis of FECD.

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to gain further insights into the molecular pathogenesis of
      Fuchs' endothelial corneal dystrophy (FECD), to identify targets for potential specific drug
      therapy.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Molecular Pathogenesis of Late-onset Fuchs' Endothelial Corneal Dystrophy

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  FECD

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  ocular infection or other ocular disease (other than FECD)

          -  ocular surgery in the past 3 weeks

          -  prior ocular irradiation therapy

study_pop.textblock:
Patients with Fuchs' Endothelial Corneal Dystrophy (FECD), normal control patients, and
        patients with non-Fuchs oedematous corneas; in university hospital setting.

facility.name: Department of Translational Cell and Tissue Research - campus Sint-Raf - UZ Leuven

investigator.last_name: Joost J van den Oord, prof. dr.

clinical_study.official_title: The Molecular Pathogenesis of Late-onset Fuchs' Endothelial Corneal Dystrophy

overall_official.last_name: Joost J van den Oord, MD, PhD

primary_outcome.description: dosage of cytokine levels in aqueous humour (exploratory, non-interventional study)
primary_outcome.time_frame: at time of prelevation (once, no intervention)

primary_outcome.description: microarray expression analysis and RT-qPCR (exploratory, non-interventional study)
primary_outcome.time_frame: at time of prelevation (once, no intervention)
